intro: Liabum cervinum, commonly known as the golden bellvista, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble small bells, hence its common name. Its leaves are palmate, with five to seven lobes, and are covered in fine hairs. Liabum cervinum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in cloud forests at elevations between 1,500 and 3,000 meters.
